trans-unit.source: Provides information about a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref> to accessibility client applications.
Windows Forms includes built-in accessibility support that allows your application to work with accessibility client applications.

Examples of accessibility client applications include screen enlarger and reviewer utilities, voice input utilities, on-screen keyboards, alternative input devices, and keyboard enhancement utilities.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject> class inherits from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject> class to provide information about a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell> to accessibility client applications.

Each class that represents a visual part of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView>—such as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewColumnHeaderCell>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell>—also contains a class that inherits from <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject> to provide information about the containing class and perform actions on behalf of accessibility client applications.

There are instances when you will want to provide additional information, such as the name or description of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> control, to accessibility client applications.
There are two ways of providing this additional information.

To provide limited accessibility information for existing controls, set the control's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.AccessibleName%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.AccessibleDescription%2A> property values, which will be reported to accessibility client applications.

You should change the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.AccessibleDefaultActionDescription%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.AccessibleRole%2A> property values only in rare situations, such as if you make a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> look like a list.

Occasionally, you might require more accessibility information or different accessibility actions to be included with your custom <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell>.

To customize accessibility, you can write your own class that derives from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataGridViewAccessibleObject> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject> classes and override the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.CreateAccessibilityInstance%2A> method.

For example, if you are writing a custom row header cell that implements unique custom actions, such as special hit testing within your cell, you should create a class that inherits from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell.DataGridViewRowHeaderCellAccessibleObject> class and override the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRowHeaderCell.CreateAccessibilityInstance%2A> method.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> exposes its data structure by using <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole> values to define the data table hierarchy.

For more information on exposing data tables to Microsoft Active Accessibility, see "Exposing Data Tables through Microsoft Active Accessibility" in the MSDN library at http://msdn.microsoft.com/library.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject"></xref> class without initializing the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Owner"></xref> property.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject"></xref> class, setting the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Owner"></xref> property to the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref> that owns the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject"></xref>.
Gets the location and size of the accessible object.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Bounds%2A> property retrieves the object's bounding rectangle in screen coordinates.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that represents the bounds of the accessible object.
The value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Owner"></xref> property is `null`.
Gets a string that describes the default action of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref>.
The string "Edit".
The value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Owner"></xref> property is `null`.
Performs the default action associated with the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject"></xref>.
If the cell associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject> is a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewHeaderCell>, this method does nothing.
Otherwise, this method selects the cell, makes it the current cell, and takes one of the following actions:
If the cell's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.ReadOnly%2A> property value is `true`, this method returns.
If the cell's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.EditType%2A> property value is `null`, meaning the cell cannot host an editing control, this method returns.

If the cell is currently entering or leaving edit mode (for example, if this method is called in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellBeginEdit> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellEndEdit> event handler), this method returns.
If the cell is currently in edit mode, this method commits and ends the edit.

If the cell is not in edit mode and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.EditMode%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewEditMode.EditProgrammatically>, this method returns.
If none of the preceding actions is taken, this method causes the cell to enter edit mode.
The value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Owner"></xref> property is `null`.
-or-

The value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject"></xref> property is not `null` and the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.RowIndex"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref> returned by the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Owner"></xref> property is equal to -1.
Returns the accessible object corresponding to the specified index.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.GetChild%2A> method returns an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject> only if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell> that owns the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject> is in edit mode and `index` is 0.
The zero-based index of the child accessible object.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject"></xref> that represents the accessible child corresponding to the specified index.
The value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Owner"></xref> property is `null`.
Returns the number of children that belong to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject"></xref>.

The value 1 if the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref> that owns <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject"></xref> is being edited; otherwise, –1.
The value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Owner"></xref> property is `null`.
Returns the child accessible object that has keyboard focus.
`null` in all cases.
Returns the child accessible object that is currently selected.
`null` in all cases.
Gets the names of the owning cell's type and base type.
This property returns a string that includes the owning cell's type name followed by the name of its base type in parentheses, such as "`DataGridViewTextBoxCell` (`DataGridViewCell`)".
The names of the owning cell's type and base type.
Gets the name of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Name%2A> property returns a string that includes the column header text and the row index of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell>.
The name of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject"></xref>.
The value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Owner"></xref> property is `null`.
Navigates to another accessible object.

The following table describes which <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell> owns the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject> that is returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Navigate%2A> method for each parameter value.
Parameter value
Description
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell> to the right of the current cell.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Navigate%2A> returns `null` if the current cell is in the right-most column.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell> to the left of the current cell.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Navigate%2A> returns an accessible object for the row header if the current cell is in the left-most column.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell> that has the next higher index.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Navigate%2A> returns `null` if the current cell is in the first column.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell> that has the next lower index.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Navigate%2A> returns `null` if the current cell is in the last column.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell> in the same column and one row above the current cell.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Navigate%2A> returns `null` if the current cell is in the first row.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell> in the same column and one row below the current cell.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Navigate%2A> returns `null` if the current cell is in the last row.
All other <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleNavigation> values
`null`.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleNavigation"></xref> values.

A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject"></xref> that represents the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref> at the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleNavigation"></xref> value.
The value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Owner"></xref> property is `null`.
Gets or sets the cell that owns the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell"></xref> that owns the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject"></xref>.
When setting this property, the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Owner"></xref> property has already been set.
Gets the parent of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Parent%2A> property returns a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow.DataGridViewRowAccessibleObject>, which represents the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewRow> that contains the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell>.
The parent of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject"></xref>.
The value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Owner"></xref> property is `null`.
Gets the role of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleRole.Cell"></xref> value.
Modifies the selection or moves the keyboard focus of the accessible object.
The following table describes the action performed by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Select%2A> method for each `flags` value.
Parameter value
Action
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> takes focus.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell> that owns this <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject> takes focus.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell> is added to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.SelectedCells%2A> property.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell> is removed from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.SelectedCells%2A> property.
All other <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleSelection> values
No action is taken.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleSelection"></xref> values.
The value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Owner"></xref> property is `null`.
Gets the state of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject"></xref>.
The return value always includes the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates.Selectable> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates.Focusable> values.

It also includes the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates.Selected> value if the associated cell is selected, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates.Focused> value if the cell has keyboard focus, and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates.Offscreen> value if the cell is not currently displayed.
A bitwise combination of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleStates"></xref> values.
The value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Owner"></xref> property is `null`.
Gets or sets a string representing the formatted value of the owning cell.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Value%2A> property contains a string that represents the value of the cell <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.FormattedValue%2A> property.
If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.FormattedValue%2A> is `null`, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Value%2A> contains the string "(null)".
Setting this property has no effect if the owning cell is a header cell, is read-only, or does not belong to a row.
Otherwise, setting this property:
Ends any edit currently in progress and commits the value.

Uses the cell <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.GetFormattedValue%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.ParseFormattedValue%2A> methods to convert the specified value to the type indicated by the cell <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.ValueType%2A> property.
Sets the cell value to the converted value.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> representation of the cell value.
The value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.DataGridViewCellAccessibleObject.Owner"></xref> property is `null`.
